intro: Savia clusiifolia var. membranacea, commonly known as the membranous clusiifolia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Clusiaceae. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often covered in a thin, waxy layer, giving them a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Brazil, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
